text:
Toxoplasmosis of the conus medullaris in a patient with hemophilia A-associated AIDS. Case report.
 Toxoplasma gondii has been reported to be the most common cause of focal brain lesions in patients with acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).
 A case of intramedullary toxoplasmosis of the conus medullaris is reported in a patient with hemophilia A-associated AIDS.
 The diagnosis is discussed, with particular emphasis on the magnetic resonance imaging appearance.
